keyMoments.title: Jean Goen's Debut
keyMoments.description: Jean Goen and his cellmates encounter Luffy wandering freely in Level 1. They are shocked and initially don't believe Luffy came from outside. When Luffy explains he's there to rescue Ace, they inform him that Ace is imprisoned on Level 5.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance of Jean Goen. Provides Luffy with crucial information about Ace's location.
keyMoments.quote: Ace is locked on Level 5, a block where prisoners with high bounties are held!

bounties.reason: Imprisoned in Level 1, which houses the least dangerous criminals

reveals.information: Imprisoned on Level 1 (Crimson Hell) of Impel Down
Has a realistic yet submissive attitude toward imprisonment

keyMoments.title: Luffy Says Hancock's Name Correctly
keyMoments.description: For the first time, Luffy calls Hancock by her actual name instead of mispronouncing it as 'Hammock', causing her to swoon.
keyMoments.significance: Shows development in Luffy and Hancock's relationship and has a profound emotional impact on Hancock.

keyMoments.title: Luffy Enters Level 1 Crimson Hell
keyMoments.description: Luffy successfully infiltrates Impel Down and arrives on Level 1, beginning his mission to rescue Ace.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the start of Luffy's dangerous journey through Impel Down's hellish levels.

keyMoments.title: Luffy's Increased Strength Revealed
keyMoments.description: Luffy effortlessly defeats multiple Blugori guards with single attacks, shocking Buggy with how much stronger he's become since East Blue.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's significant power growth and ability to handle deeper Impel Down levels.

keyMoments.title: Alliance with Buggy
keyMoments.description: Luffy agrees to give Buggy Captain John's treasure armband in exchange for Buggy escorting him to Level 4.
keyMoments.significance: Forms a crucial alliance for navigating Impel Down's dangerous levels.

relationships.description: Hancock helps Luffy infiltrate Impel Down to rescue Ace, risking her position as a Warlord.

evolutionMoments.description: Luffy calls Hancock by her real name for the first time, deepening their bond.

relationships.description: Luffy and Buggy form an alliance to navigate Impel Down despite their past as enemies.

evolutionMoments.description: Luffy and Buggy reunite in Level 1 and agree to work together.

reveals.information: Has grown significantly stronger since East Blue, can defeat Blugori guards effortlessly
Possesses Captain John's treasure map armband from Thriller Bark

keyMoments.title: Luffy and Buggy Reunion
keyMoments.description: Buggy is discovered attempting to escape from Level 1 when Luffy hears him crying in distress. The two are shocked to encounter each other again.
keyMoments.significance: Reunites two characters from East Blue and sets up their unlikely alliance in Impel Down.

keyMoments.title: Buggy Proposes Alliance
keyMoments.description: Buggy recognizes Captain John's treasure map on Luffy's armband and proposes to escort Luffy to Level 4 in exchange for the armband.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the terms of the Luffy-Buggy alliance that will be crucial throughout Impel Down.
keyMoments.quote: I'll escort you to Level 4, but in return you have to give me that armband!

keyMoments.title: Buggy Remembers Shanks
keyMoments.description: During the fight, Buggy flashes back to his resentment toward both Luffy and Shanks.
keyMoments.significance: Reinforces Buggy's complex history with Shanks from their time on Roger's crew.

relationships.description: Forms an alliance with Luffy to navigate Impel Down in exchange for Captain John's treasure map.

evolutionMoments.description: Buggy agrees to help Luffy reach Level 4 in exchange for the treasure map armband.

relationships.description: Buggy harbors resentment toward Shanks from their time together on Roger's crew.

evolutionMoments.description: Buggy briefly reflects on his lingering resentment toward Shanks.

reveals.information: Imprisoned in Level 1 (Crimson Hell) of Impel Down
Seeking Captain John's treasure and recognizes the map on Luffy's armband
His Bara Bara no Mi powers make him immune to the cutting torture of Level 1's blade-like leaves

keyMoments.title: Hancock Petrifies Domino
keyMoments.description: Hancock uses her Mero Mero no Mi powers to petrify Domino and the surveillance equipment, enabling Luffy to infiltrate Impel Down.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Hancock's willingness to risk everything to help Luffy, including her position as a Warlord.

keyMoments.title: Luffy Says Her Name Correctly
keyMoments.description: Hancock swoons and falls to the ground when Luffy calls her by her real name instead of 'Hammock', dreaming of marriage.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals the depth of Hancock's feelings for Luffy and her emotional vulnerability.

relationships.description: Hancock is deeply in love with Luffy and risks her position to help him rescue Ace.

evolutionMoments.description: Hancock's feelings deepen when Luffy says her name correctly, causing her to dream of marriage.

reveals.information: Dreams of marrying Luffy after he says her name correctly
Willing to use her Devil Fruit powers deceptively to help Luffy, risking her Warlord status

keyMoments.title: Domino Petrified by Hancock
keyMoments.description: Domino is turned to stone by Hancock's Mero Mero no Mi powers during a body check, preventing her from discovering Luffy. She later reverts to normal with no memory of being petrified.
keyMoments.significance: Enables Luffy's successful infiltration of Impel Down by preventing detection.

reveals.information: Susceptible to Hancock's Mero Mero no Mi petrification powers despite being a high-ranking guard
Has no memory of being petrified when she returns to normal
